str2: No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
(a) of time: still, yet, even now, (b) of degree: even, further, more, in addition. Perhaps akin to etos; 'yet, ' still.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To be hungry, needy, desire earnestly. From the same as penes; to famish; figuratively, to crave.
Neither, nor, not even, and not. From ou and de; not however, i.e. Neither, nor, not even.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To thirst for, desire earnestly. From a variation of dipsos; to thirst for.
Neither, nor, not even, and not. From ou and de; not however, i.e. Neither, nor, not even.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The sun, sunlight. From hele; the sun; by implication, light.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A reduplicated and contracted form of peto; probably akin to petomai through the idea of alighting; to fall.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Neither, nor, not even, and not. From ou and de; not however, i.e. Neither, nor, not even.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Burning heat, heat. From kaio; properly, a burn, but used of a glow.
